bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Memo from the Clerk
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the district Court of Second Judicial District of Washington Terry. holding terms at Tacoma, in and for Pierce County.
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx x In the matter of the application ofx x M.A. Walker x x for a WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS. x x xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
to LEWIS BYRD, Sheriff of Pierce County, greeting:--

We command you, that you have the body of M.A. WALEKR, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said M.A. Walker, shall be called or charged, before Hon. JOHN P. HOYT, Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, at Olympia, on the 1st day of , 1885, at 2 oclock, P.,M, of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said M.A. WALKER, And have you then and there this writ.
Witness the HON JOHN P. HOYT, Judge of the said District Court, at the Court room there-of in the City of Tacoma, Pierce County, Wahs. Terry. this 2nd day of August, 1885.
R.G. OBrien Clerk By J Deputy Clerk
